content.question: Moving from left to right: The curve passes from quadrant 2 to quadrant 3 to quadrant 4 to quadrant 1. In quadrant 2 the curve falls sharply to the x axis. In quadrant 3, the curve falls sharply to cross the y axis at point A. In quadrant 4: The curve falls sharply before it levels off. The curve then turns and rises sharply, passing through point B, to the x axis. In quadrant 1: The curve rises sharply before it levels off at point C. The curve then falls sharply, passing through point D, before it levels off at point E on the x axis. The curve then rises sharply. The figure shows the graph of a polynomial function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>. Consider the five points labeled <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math>, <math alttext="D"><mi>D</mi></math>, and <math alttext="E"><mi>E</mi></math>. These points indicate locations of intercepts and extrema for <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> and points of inflection of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is the location of a relative minimum, <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> is the location of a relative maximum, and <math alttext="D"><mi>D</mi></math> is a point of inflection of the graph.

<math alttext="E"><mi>E</mi></math> is the location of a relative minimum, <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> is the location of a relative maximum, and <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> is a point of inflection of the graph.

<math alttext="E"><mi>E</mi></math> is the location of a relative minimum, <math alttext="D"><mi>D</mi></math> is the location of a relative maximum, and <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> is a point of inflection of the graph.

<math alttext="E"><mi>E</mi></math> is the location of a relative minimum, <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> is the location of a relative maximum, and <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a point of inflection of the graph.

content.answer: <math alttext="E"><mi>E</mi></math> is the location of a relative minimum, <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> is the location of a relative maximum, and <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> is a point of inflection of the graph.
